heading: 11.3.1 Mean and variance
text:
Let \(X\) continuous random variable. mean \(X\), \(\mu_X\), simply \(\mbox{E}(X)\). Thus,
\[
\mbox{E}(X)=\int_{S_X}x\cdot f_X(x)\mathop{}\!\mathrm{d}x
\]discrete case, variance \(X\) expected squared difference mean, \(\mbox{E}[(X-\mu_X)^2]\). Thus,
\[
\sigma^2_X = \mbox{Var}(X)=\mbox{E}[(X-\mu_X)^2]= \int_{S_X} (x-\mu_X)^2\cdot f_X(x) \mathop{}\!\mathrm{d}x
\]Recall homework problem 6 last chapter. problem, showed \(\mbox{Var}(X)=\mbox{E}(X^2)-\mbox{E}(X)^2\). Thus,
\[
\mbox{Var}(X)=\mbox{E}(X^2)-\mbox{E}(X)^2 = \int_{S_X} x^2\cdot f_X(x)\mathop{}\!\mathrm{d}x - \mu_X^2
\]Example:
Consider random variable \(X\) . Find mean variance \(X\).
\[
\mu_X= \mbox{E}(X)=\int_0^1 x\cdot 2x\mathop{}\!\mathrm{d}x = \frac{2x^3}{3}\bigg|_0^1 = \frac{2}{3}=0.667
\]Side note: Since mean \(X\) smaller median \(X\), say \(X\) skewed left, negatively skewed.Using R.using antiD()Using simulation.\[
\sigma^2_X = \mbox{Var}(X)= \mbox{E}(X^2)-\mbox{E}(X)^2 = \int_0^1 x^2\cdot 2x\mathop{}\!\mathrm{d}x - \left(\frac{2}{3}\right)^2 = \frac{2x^4}{4}\bigg|_0^1-\frac{4}{9}=\frac{1}{2}-\frac{4}{9}=\frac{1}{18}=0.056
\]orAnd finally, standard deviation \(X\) \(\sigma_X = \sqrt{\sigma^2_X}=\sqrt{1/18}=0.236\).

plot_ss <- function (x, y, data, showSquares = FALSE, leastSquares = FALSE) 
{
    x <- eval(substitute(x), data)
    y <- eval(substitute(y), data)
    plot(y ~ x, asp = 1, pch = 16)
    if (leastSquares) {
        m1 <- lm(y ~ x)
        y.hat <- m1$fit
    }
    else {
        cat("Click two points to make a line.")
        pt1 <- locator(1)
        points(pt1$x, pt1$y, pch = 4)
        pt2 <- locator(1)
        points(pt2$x, pt2$y, pch = 4)
        pts <- data.frame(x = c(pt1$x, pt2$x), y = c(pt1$y, pt2$y))
        m1 <- lm(y ~ x, data = pts)
        y.hat <- predict(m1, newdata = data.frame(x))
    }
    r <- y - y.hat
    abline(m1)
    oSide <- x - r
    LLim <- par()$usr[1]
    RLim <- par()$usr[2]
    oSide[oSide < LLim | oSide > RLim] <- c(x + r)[oSide < LLim | 
        oSide > RLim]
    n <- length(y.hat)
    for (i in 1:n) {
        lines(rep(x[i], 2), c(y[i], y.hat[i]), lty = 2, col = "blue")
        if (showSquares) {
            lines(rep(oSide[i], 2), c(y[i], y.hat[i]), lty = 3, 
                col = "orange")
            lines(c(oSide[i], x[i]), rep(y.hat[i], 2), lty = 3, 
                col = "orange")
            lines(c(oSide[i], x[i]), rep(y[i], 2), lty = 3, col = "orange")
        }
    }
    SS <- round(sum(r^2), 3)
    cat("\r                                ")
    print(m1)
    cat("Sum of Squares: ", SS)
}
